standard_metadata.standard_description: Use facts about supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles in a multi-step problem to write and solve simple equations for an unknown angle in a figure.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Finding angle measures between intersecting lines

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F is labeled 73 degrees. Angle C G E is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: $\goldD{\angle{EGB}}$ and $\greenD{\angle{AGF}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\goldD{\angle{EGB}}=\greenD{\angle{AGF}} $. Both angles are $73^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F and E G B are labeled as 73 degrees each. Angle C G E is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: Because we know $\overline{AB}$ forms a right angle with $\overline{CD}$, we know $\purpleD{\angle{CGB}} = 90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F and E G B are labeled as 73 degrees each. Angle C G E is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees.

hints.content: $\begin{align}\blueD{x} + \goldD{\angle{EGB}}  &= \purpleD{90^\circ} \\\\ \blueD x + \goldD{73^\circ} &= \purpleD{90^\circ}  \\\\ \blueD x &= \blueD{17^\circ} \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F and E G B are labeled as 73 degrees each. Angle C G E is labeled 17 degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F is labeled 77 degrees. Angle C G E is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: $\goldD{\angle{EGB}}$ and $\greenD{\angle{AGF}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\goldD{\angle{EGB}}=\greenD{\angle{AGF}} $. Both angles are $77^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F and E G B are labeled as 77 degrees each. Angle C G E is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: Because we know $\overline{AB}$ forms a right angle with $\overline{CD}$, we know $\purpleD{\angle{CGB}} = 90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F and E G B are labeled as 77 degrees each. Angle C G E is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees.

hints.content: $\begin{align}\blueD x + \goldD{\angle{EGB}}  &= \purpleD{90^\circ} \\\\ \blueD x + \goldD{77^\circ} &= \purpleD{90^\circ}  \\\\ \blueD x &= \blueD{13^\circ} \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle A G F and E G B are labeled as 77 degrees each. Angle C G E is labeled 13 degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled X degrees. Angle E G C is labeled 23 degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{CGE}}$ and $\goldD{\angle{FGD}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\blueD{\angle{CGE}} =\goldD{\angle{FGD}}$. Both angles are $23^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled X degrees. Angle E G C and F GD are labeled as 23 degrees each. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: Because we know $\overline{AB}$ forms a right angle with $\overline{CD}$, we know $\purpleD{\angle{AGD}} = 90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled X degrees. Angle E G C and F G D are labeled as 23 degrees each. Angle A G C and A G D are perpendicular.

hints.content: $\begin{align}\greenD x + \goldD{\angle{FGD}}  &= \purpleD{90^\circ} \\\\ \greenD x + \goldD{23^\circ} &= \purpleD{90^\circ}  \\\\ \greenD x &= \greenD{67^\circ} \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled 67 degrees. Angle E G C and F G D are labeled as 23 degrees each. Angle A G C and A G D are perpendicular.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled X degrees. Angle E G C is labeled 15 degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{CGE}}$ and $\goldD{\angle{FGD}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\blueD{\angle{CGE}} =\goldD{\angle{FGD}}$. Both angles are $15^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled X degrees. Angle E G C and F G D are labeled as 15 degrees each. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: Because we know $\overline{AB}$ forms a right angle with $\overline{CD}$, we know $\purpleD{\angle{AGD}} = 90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled X degrees. Angle E G C and F G D are labeled as 15 degrees each. Angle A G C and AG D are perpendicular.

hints.content: $\begin{align}\greenD x + \goldD{\angle{FGD}}  &= \purpleD{90^\circ} \\\\ \greenD x + \goldD{15^\circ} &= \purpleD{90^\circ}  \\\\ \greenD x &= \greenD{75^\circ} \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G A is labeled 75 degrees. Angle E G C and F G D are labeled as 15 degrees each. Angle A G C and A G D are perpendicular.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Horizontal line segment A B and vertical line segment C D intersect each other at point G. A B and C D are perpendicular to each other. Line segment F E intersects A B at point G. Angle E G B is labeled X degrees. Angle F G D is labeled 30 degrees. Point B is on the opposite half place of C D.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FGD}}$ and $\goldD{\angle{CGE}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FGD}} = \goldD{\angle{CGE}}$.  Both angles are $30^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Horizontal line segment A B and vertical line segment C D intersect each other at point G. A B and C D are perpendicular to each other. Line segment F E intersects AB at point G. Angle E G B is labeled X degrees. Angle F G D and C G E are labeled as 30 degrees each.

hints.content: Because we know $\overline{AB}$ forms a right angle with $\overline{CD}$, we know $\purpleD{\angle{CGB}} = 90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Horizontal line segment A B and vertical line segment C D intersect each other at point G. A B and C D are perpendicular to each other. Line segment F E intersects A B at point G. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees. Angle E G B is labeled X degrees. Angles C G E and F G D are labeled 30 degrees each.

hints.content: $\begin{align}\goldD{\angle{CGE}} + \blueD x  &= \purpleD{90^\circ} \\\\ \goldD{30^\circ} + \blueD x &= \purpleD{90^\circ}  \\\\ \blueD x &= \blueD{60^\circ} \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Horizontal line segment A B and vertical line segment C D intersect each other at point G. A B and C D are perpendicular to each other. Line segment F E intersects A B at point G. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees. Angle E G B is labeled 60 degrees. Angles C G E and F G D are labeled 30 degrees each. Point B is on the opposite half place of C D.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G D is labeled 22 degrees. Angle E G B is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FGD}}$ and $\goldD{\angle{CGE}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FGD}} = \goldD{\angle{CGE}}$.  Both angles are $22^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F GD and E G C are labeled as 22 degrees each. Angle E G B is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: Because we know $\overline{AB}$ forms a right angle with $\overline{CD}$, we know $\purpleD{\angle{CGB}} = 90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G D and E G C are labeled as 22 degrees each. Angle E G B is labeled X degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees.

hints.content: $\begin{align}\goldD{\angle{CGE}} + \blueD x  &= \purpleD{90^\circ} \\\\ \goldD{22^\circ} + \blueD x &= \purpleD{90^\circ}  \\\\ \blueD x &= \blueD{68^\circ} \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F G D and E G C are labeled as 22 degrees each. Angle E G B is labeled 68 degrees. Angle A G C is perpendicular. Angle C G B is labeled 90 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: A line labeled as E D. A is the point between E and D. Three angles made by the 2 rays that is A B and A C are divided it into unequal parts. The measurements of these unequal angles that is E A B, B A C, C A D are 100 degrees, X degrees and 20 degrees respectively.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{EAB}}$, $\greenD{\angle{x}}$, and $\purpleD{\angle DAC}$  form a straight line.
Angles that form a straight line have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\blueD{\angle{EAB}} +\greenD{\angle{x}} +\purpleD{\angle DAC} = 180^\circ$

$\begin{align}\blueD{\angle{EAB}} +\greenD x +\purpleD{\angle DAC}  &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{100^\circ} + \greenD x +\purpleD{20^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD x + 120^\circ & = 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD x &= 60^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A line labeled as E D. A is the point between E and D. Three angles made by the 2 rays that is A B and A C are divided it into unequal parts. The measurements of these unequal angles that is E A B, B A C, C A D are 100 degrees, 60 degrees and 20 degrees respectively.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: A line labeled as E D. A is the point between E and D. Three angles made by the 2 rays are divided it into unequal parts. The measurements of these unequal angles that is E A B, B A C, C A D are X degrees, 105 degrees and 25 degrees respectively.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle x}$, $\greenD{\angle{BAC}}$, and $\purpleD{\angle DAC}$ form a straight line.
Angles that form a straight line have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\blueD{\angle x}+\greenD{\angle{BAC}}+\purpleD{\angle DAC}= 180^\circ$

$\begin{align}\blueD x+\greenD{\angle{BAC}}+\purpleD{\angle DAC}  &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD x + \greenD{105^\circ} +\purpleD{25^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD x + 130^\circ & = 180^\circ \\\\ \blueD x &= 50^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A line labeled as E D. A is the point between E and D. Three angles made by the 2 rays are divided it into unequal parts. The measurements of these unequal angles that is E A B, B A C, C A D are labeled 50 degrees, 105 degrees, and 25 degrees respectively.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines labeled as E C and D F intersect each other at A. A ray is passing from A is labeled as A B. The angles D A B, B A C and C A F are labeled as X degrees, 80 degree and 60 degrees, respectively.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle x}$, $\greenD{\angle BAC}$, and $\blueD{\angle CAF }$ form a straight line.
Angles that form a straight line have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\purpleD{\angle x}+\greenD{\angle BAC}+\blueD{\angle CAF }= 180^\circ$

$\begin{align}\purpleD x+\greenD{\angle BAC}+\blueD{\angle CAF} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD x  +\greenD{80^\circ} + \blueD{\angle 60^\circ}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD x + 140^\circ & = 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD x &= 40^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines labeled as E C and D F intersect each other at A. A ray is passing from A is labeled as A B. The angles DA B, BA C and CAF are labeled as 40 degrees, 80 degree and 60 degrees, respectively.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two lines labeled as E C and D F intersect each other at A. A ray is passing from A is labeled as A B. The angles DA B, BA C and CAF are labeled as 64 degrees, x degree and 60 degrees, respectively.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle DAB}$, $\greenD{\angle x}$, and $\blueD{\angle CAF }$ form a straight line.
Angles that form a straight line have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\purpleD{\angle DAB}+\greenD{\angle x}+\blueD{\angle CAF }= 180^\circ$

$\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle DAB}+\greenD x+\blueD{\angle CAF} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD{64^\circ}  +\greenD x + \blueD{ 60^\circ}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD x + 124^\circ & = 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD x &= 56^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines labeled as E C and D F intersect each other at A. A ray is passing from A is labeled as A B. The angles DA B, BA C and CAF are labeled as 64 degrees, 56 degree and 60 degrees, respectively.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A C, E F and B D intersect each other at point G. Angle A E G is labeled 30 degrees. Angle B G F is labeled X degrees. Angle D G C is labeled 90 degrees.

hints.content: $\maroonD{\angle DGC} $ and $\maroonD{\angle{A GB}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\maroonD{\angle DGC} =\maroonD{\angle{AGB}}$ .  Both angles are $90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A C, E F and B D intersect each other at point G. Angle A G E is labeled 30 degrees. Angle B G F is labeled X degrees. Angle A G B and D G C is labeled 90 degrees.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{EGA}}$, $\maroonD{\angle AGB}$, and  $\greenD{\angle{BGF}}$  form a straight line.
Angles that form a straight line have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\blueD{\angle{EGA}}+\maroonD{\angle AGB}+\greenD{\angle{BGF}} = 180^\circ$

$\begin{align}\blueD{\angle{EGA}}+\maroonD{\angle AGB}+\greenD x &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{30^\circ} + \maroonD{90^\circ} +\greenD x &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD x + 120^\circ & = 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD x &= 60^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A C, E F and B D intersect each other at point G. Angle A G E is labeled 30 degrees. Angle B G F is labeled 60 degrees. Angle A G B and D G C is labeled 90 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A C, B D and E F intersect each other at point G. Angle F GB is labeled X degrees. Angle EGA is labeled 55 degrees. Angle D G C is perpendicular.

hints.content: $\maroonD{\angle DGC} $ and $\maroonD{\angle{AGB}}$ are vertical angles, because they are opposite from each other.   Vertical angles are congruent, so $\maroonD{\angle DGC} =\maroonD{\angle{AGB}}$ .  Both angles are $90^\circ$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A C, B D and F E intersect each other at point G. Angle F GB is labeled X degrees. Angle EGA is labeled 55 degrees. Angle D G C and A G B are perpendicular.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{EGA}}$, $\maroonD{\angle AGB}$, and  $\greenD{\angle{BGF}}$  form a straight line.
Angles that form a straight line have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\blueD{\angle{EGA}}+\maroonD{\angle AGB}+\greenD{\angle{BGF}} = 180^\circ$

$\begin{align}\blueD{\angle{EGA}}+\maroonD{\angle AGB}+\greenD x &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{55^\circ} + \maroonD{90^\circ} +\greenD x &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD x + 145^\circ & = 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD x &= 35^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A C, B D and F E intersect each other at point G. Angle F GB is labeled X degrees. Angle EGA is labeled 55 degrees. Angle D G C and angle A G B are perpendicular.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Three intersecting lines are labeled as A B, A D, and D C. A B is horizontal and point P is labeled between A and B, and A D and C D are slanting lines. A D points upward from the horizontal line, and the C D points downward from the horizontal line. The angles on the right, between the horizontal line and the slanted line that is angle D P B and angle C P B are labeled as 32 degrees and X degrees.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{x}}$ and  $\greenD{\angle{DPB}}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.
Supplementary angles have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\blueD{\angle{x}}+\greenD{\angle{DPB}} = 180^\circ$
$\begin{align}\blueD x+\greenD{\angle{DPB}}  &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD x +\greenD{\angle 32^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD x & = 148^\circ  \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Three intersecting lines labeled as A B, A D, and DC. A B is horizontal and point P is labeled between A and B,and A D and C D are slanting lines. A D points upward from the horizontal line, and the C D points downward from the horizontal line. The angles on the right, between the horizontal line and the slanted line that is angle D P B and angle C P B are labeled as 32 degree and 148 degree.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Three intersecting lines labeled as A B, A D, and D C. A B is horizontal and point P is labeled between A and B, and A D and C D are slanting lines. A D points upward from the horizontal line, and the C D points downward from the horizontal line. The angles on the right, between the horizontal line and the slanted line that is angle D P B and angle C P B are labeled as x degree and 133 degrees.

hints.content: $\blueD{\angle{CPB}}$ and  $\greenD{\angle{x}}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.
Supplementary angles have a sum of $180^\circ$.  $\blueD{\angle{CPB}}+\greenD{\angle{x}} = 180^\circ$
$\begin{align}\blueD{\angle{CPB}}+\greenD x    &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{133^\circ} +\greenD x &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD x & = 47^\circ  \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Three intersecting lines labeled as A B, A D, and DC. A B is horizontal and point P is labeled between A and B,and A D and C D are slanting lines. A D points upward from the horizontal line, and the C D points downward from the horizontal line. The angles on the right, between the horizontal line and the slanted line that is angle D P B and angle C P B are labeled as 47 degree and 133 degree.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle A E G and F E D are labeled as X degrees and 80 degrees respectively. Angle D E B is labeled 20 degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FED}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{DEB}}$ combine to form $\angle{FEB}$, which is a vertical angle with $\goldD{\angle x}$ because it is opposite from $\goldD{\angle x}$.  Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}} = \goldD{\angle x}$.
$\begin{align}\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}}&=  \goldD x \\\\ \greenD{80^\circ} + \blueD{20^\circ}  &= \goldD x  \\\\ 100^\circ & = \goldD x  \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle A E G and F ED are labeled as 100 degrees and 80 degrees respectively. Angle D E B is labeled 20 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle A E G and F ED are labeled as X degrees and 50 degrees respectively. Angle D E B is labeled 20 degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FED}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{DEB}}$ combine to form $\angle{FEB}$, which is a vertical angle with $\goldD{\angle x}$ because it is opposite from $\goldD{\angle x}$.  Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}} = \goldD{\angle x}$.
$\begin{align}\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}}&=  \goldD x \\\\ \greenD{50^\circ} + \blueD{20^\circ}  &= \goldD x  \\\\ 70^\circ & = \goldD x  \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle A E G and F ED are labeled as 70 degrees and 50 degrees respectively. Angle D E B is labeled 20 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle F E A and F E D are labeled as X degrees and 80 degrees respectively. Angle C E B is labeled 160 degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FED}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{x}}$ combine to form $\angle{AED}$, which is a vertical angle with $\goldD{\angle CEB}$ because it is opposite from $\goldD{\angle CEB}$.  Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{x}} = \goldD{\angle CEB}$.
$\begin{align}\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD x &=  \goldD{160^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{80^\circ} + \blueD x  &= \goldD{160^\circ}  \\\\ \blueD x & = 80^\circ \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle F E A and F E D are labeled as 80 degrees each. Angle CEB is labeled 160 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle A E F and F E D are labeled as X degrees and 115 degrees respectively. Angle C E B is labeled 160 degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FED}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{x}}$ combine to form $\angle{AED}$, which is a vertical angle with $\goldD{\angle CEB}$ because it is opposite from $\goldD{\angle CEB}$.  Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{x}} = \goldD{\angle CEB}$.
$\begin{align}\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD x&=  \goldD{160^\circ} \\\\ \greenD{115^\circ} + \blueD x  &= \goldD{160^\circ}  \\\\ \blueD x & = 45^\circ  \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle A E F and F E D are labeled as 45 degrees and 115 degrees respectively. Angle C E B is labeled 160 degrees.

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle F E D and D E B are labeled as 130 degree and 20 degrees respectively. Angle A E G is labeled X degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{FED}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{DEB}}$ combine to form $\angle{FEB}$, which is a vertical angle with $\goldD{\angle x}$ because it is opposite from $\goldD{\angle x}$.  Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}} = \goldD{\angle x}$.
$\begin{align}\greenD{\angle{FED}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}}&=  \goldD x \\\\ \greenD{130^\circ} + \blueD{20^\circ}  &= \goldD x  \\\\ 150^\circ & = \goldD x  \end{align}$

question.content: *NOTE: Angles not necessarily drawn to scale.*  $x = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle D E B and B E G are labeled as 20 degrees and 25 degrees respectively. Angle F E C is labeled X degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle{BEG}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{DEB}}$ combine to form $\angle{DEG}$, which is a vertical angle with $\goldD{\angle x}$ because it is opposite from $\goldD{\angle x}$.    Vertical angles are congruent, so $\greenD{\angle{BEG}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}} = \goldD{\angle x}$.
$\begin{align}\greenD{\angle{BEG}} +\blueD{\angle{DEB}}&=  \goldD x \\\\ \greenD{25^\circ} + \blueD{20^\circ}  &= \goldD x  \\\\ 45^\circ & = \goldD x  \end{align}$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Lines A B, C D and F G intersect each other at point E. Angle D E B and B E G are labeled as 20 degrees and 25 degrees respectively. Angle F E C is labeled 45 degrees.
